entry.title: SMS Delivery Delays from Twilio Toll-Free Numbers to US Carriers
entry.summary: Nov 26, 16:19 PST Update - Please find the current SMS delivery status from Twilio toll-free numbers for the major carriers below: AT&T (status - Operational) T-Mobile (status - Operational) Sprint (status - Operational) Verizon (status - Operational) MetroPCS (status - Operational) US Cellular (status - Operational) Appalachian Wireless (status - Delayed) We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as we have any new information to share. Nov 26, 14:16 PST Update - Please find the current SMS delivery status from Twilio toll-free numbers for the major carriers below: AT&T (status - Operational) T-Mobile (status - Operational) Sprint (status - Operational) Verizon (status - Operational) MetroPCS (status - Operational) US Cellular (status - Operational) Appalachian Wireless (status - Delayed) We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as we have any new information to share. Nov 26, 12:16 PST Investigating - Due to sustained high traffic on the US carrier networks, we are currently experiencing SMS delivery delays from Twilio toll-free numbers. Messages are queued due to capacity shortage, and customers may see delays when sending to certain US carriers. Please find the current delivery status for the major carriers below: US AT&T (status - Operational) T-Mobile (status - Operational) Sprint (status - Operational) Verizon (status - Operational) MetroPCS (status - Operational) US Cellular (status - Operational) Appalachian Wireless (status - Delayed) We are actively working with our carrier partners to resolve the issue, and we will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as we have any new information to share.

entry.title: Incident: Issues with search in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From November 23, 2022 at 19:30 PST to November 23, 2022 at 20:22, some users were unable to send messages, load content or use workflows within Slack. We discovered the issue was related to a recent change which accidentally severed access to a number of endpoints. A network change was made and most services started to auto-recover and work again.
During the restore process some users experienced search errors or slow responses within the search bar. This was resolved on November 24, 2022 at 17:58 PST, restoring functionality for all affected users.

Apologies for the inconvenience caused due to this incident and thank you for your patience and understanding. Nov 20, 21:38 PST Monitoring - The cause of the errors has been identified and a fix has been implemented. As such, error rates have already decreased to normal levels. We are monitoring the situation and will resolve the incident soon. Please retry any requests that may have failed with 500 Errors. Nov 20, 20:48 PST Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated rates of 500 Errors when attempting to update Async Calendars API.

entry.title: TS-2022-004
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41924 Severity: Critical CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:H Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale Windows client allows a malicious website to reconfigure the Tailscale daemon tailscaled, which can then be used to remotely execute code. Affected platforms: Windows Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale Windows client, the local API was bound to a local TCP socket, and communicated with the Windows client GUI in cleartext with no Host header verification. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then make local API requests in the client, including changing the coordination server to an attacker-controlled coordination server. Who is affected? All Windows clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? If you are running Tailscale on Windows, upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker-controlled coordination server can send malicious URL responses to the client, including pushing executables or installing an SMB share. These allow the attacker to remotely execute code on the node. Reviewing all logs confirms this vulnerability was not triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.

entry.title: TS-2022-005
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41925 Severity: Low CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale client allows a malicious website to access the peer API, which can then be used to access Tailscale environment variables. Affected platforms: All Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale client, the peer API was vulnerable to DNS rebinding. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS for the peer API to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then making peer API requests in the client, including accessing the node’s Tailscale environment variables. Who is affected? All Tailscale clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? Upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker with access to the peer API on a node could use that access to read the node’s environment variables, including any credentials or secrets stored in environment variables. This may include Tailscale authentication keys, which could then be used to add new nodes to the user’s tailnet. The peer API access could also be used to learn of other nodes in the tailnet or send files via Taildrop. An attacker with access to the peer API who sent a malicious file via Taildrop which was accessed while it was loading could use this to gain access to the local API, and remotely execute code. There is no evidence of this vulnerability being purposefully triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.

entry.title: Incident: Some users are unable to post messages
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On November 14th at 9:46 AM PST to 1:31 PM PST, a planned code change for workspaces on the Free plan resulted in some users seeing the error message "Slack couldn't send this message" when trying to send messages.
We have reverted this code change for further review and refinement.

entry.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance
entry.summary: Nov 4, 06:05 CET Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Nov 4, 05:00 CET In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Nov 2, 12:39 CET Scheduled - Please note there is scheduled infrastructure maintenance on Friday 4th of November, between 5 AM and 7 AM CET, when you can expect a few short service interruptions. During this maintenance following services will be affected: - Migrations will not be available - Shared hooks created within maintenance will not be accepted nor processed - Logins to the platform might be affected - Registration of new subscribers won't be possible - Invitations of new team members won't be possible - E-mails and notifications might be delayed - Password reset won't be possible - Payments for subscription plans won't be accepted We will inform you once the maintenance is completed.

entry.title: GitHub Importer Maintenance
entry.summary: Nov 4, 04:01 UTC Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. Nov 4, 03:00 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. Oct 27, 17:00 UTC Scheduled - GitHub Importer—namely the “Import repository” (https://github.com/new/import) UI on GitHub.com and the "Source Imports" (https://docs.github.com/en/rest/migrations/source-imports) REST API—will be undergoing scheduled maintenance. During this time, no new source imports will be processed. You will not be able to start new source imports until the end of the maintenance window.

entry.title: Incident: Users having trouble creating a workflow in Workflow Builder
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Wednesday, November 2nd at 2:12 PM PST to 4:34 PM PST, some users were running into issues with publishing a workflow when using Workflow Builder. Clicking the “Next” button would not return any response, and would cause a workflow to remain in its unpublished state. A new code change had been deployed that caused us to exit early in workflow creation and this is now fixed.

entry.title: Incident: For an emoji sent as a standalone message, the emoji code is not displayed on hover
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
On Wednesday, October 26th at 2:15 PM PST Friday to October 28th 9:12 PM PST, some users were unable to view emoji/code previews when hovering their cursor over messages containing emojis. Upon investigation, we discovered that an error had occurred with the jumbomoji (a message with just an emoji) previewer during the process of a backend code-change we were performing related to emoji. Once we learned this, we were able to deploy a fix which rectified this issue for all affected users.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues sending messages, loading threads, and saving bookmarks
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On October 28, 2022 from about 1:06 PM PDT to 1:17 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading threads, sending messages, and saving bookmarks.
This issue occurred when we deployed a web app change resulting in an increased database load. We have since rolled back the deploy, restoring functionality for all affected users.
